summary: This is a 'nolle prosequi' filing from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, recommending the dismissal of charges against Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. The defendants were previously indicted for conspiracy to defraud the United States and making false documents, but entered deferred prosecution agreements which they successfully completed.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: One of the two defendants charged with conspiring to defraud the United States and making false documents. Successfully completed a deferred prosecution agreement, leading to the recommendation to dismiss charges.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: One of the two defendants charged with conspiring to defraud the United States and making false documents. Successfully completed a deferred prosecution agreement, leading to the recommendation to dismiss charges.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed and submitted the nolle prosequi recommendation to the court on behalf of the Government.

persons.name: Analisa Torres
persons.context: The judge who signed and ordered the nolle prosequi, formally dismissing the case against the defendants.

connections.description: Both were charged together in the same indictment for conspiring to defraud the United States and make false documents.
Roos, as an AUSA, represented the Government in the prosecution and later recommended dismissal of charges against Noel.
Roos, as an AUSA, represented the Government in the prosecution and later recommended dismissal of charges against Thomas.
Judge Torres presided over the case and issued the order dismissing the charges against Noel.
Judge Torres presided over the case and issued the order dismissing the charges against Thomas.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment
events.description: A grand jury returned Indictment 19 Cr. 830 (AT), charging Tova Noel and Michael Thomas with conspiracy to defraud the United States and making false documents.

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreements Signed
events.description: Tova Noel and Michael Thomas entered into deferred prosecution agreements with the Government, deferring prosecution for six months contingent on good behavior and community service.

events.title: Deferral Period Expired
events.description: The six-month deferral period for the prosecution agreements expired. The U.S. Pretrial Services Office informed the Government that Noel and Thomas had complied with the terms.

events.title: Nolle Prosequi Recommendation Filed
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Nicolas Roos filed the recommendation for a nolle prosequi (dismissal of charges) due to the defendants' successful completion of their deferred prosecution agreements.

events.title: Court Orders Dismissal
events.description: Judge Analisa Torres signed the order, directing that a nolle prosequi be filed, formally dismissing the case against Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

keyFacts: Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were charged in a federal indictment (19 Cr. 830) for conspiracy to defraud the United States and making false documents.
Both defendants entered into deferred prosecution agreements on May 20, 2021, avoiding immediate prosecution in exchange for good behavior and community service.
The U.S. Pretrial Services Office confirmed that both defendants successfully complied with the terms of their agreements during the six-month deferral period.
Based on their compliance, the U.S. Attorney's Office recommended a 'nolle prosequi,' a formal dismissal of the charges, which was ordered by Judge Analisa Torres.
This document represents the final legal resolution of the criminal case against Noel and Thomas, resulting in no conviction due to the successful deferred prosecution.
